contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Governor |name=William Jayne |image=William_Jayne.jpg |order=1st |office=Governor of Dakota Territory |term_start=1861 |term_end=1863 |lieutenant= |predecessor= |successor=[[Newton Edmunds]] |birth_date={{birth date|1826|10|8|mf=y}} |birth_place=[[Springfield, Illinois]] |death_date={{death date and age|1916|3|20|1826|10|8|mf=y}} |death_place=[[Springfield, Illinois]] |party= |spouse=Julia Witherbee |profession=[[Physician]] |signature=William_Jayne_Signature.jpg |signature_alt=Cursive signature in ink |religion= |president= [[Abraham Lincoln]] }} {{distinguish|Billy Jayne}} '''William A. Jayne''' (October 8, 1826{{spaced ndash}}March 20, 1916) was an [[United States|American]] physician and statesman. He served as Governor of the [[Dakota Territory]] and as the territory's delegate to the [[United States House of Representatives]] during the [[American Civil War]]. William was born in [[Springfield, Illinois]]. He attended [[Illinois College]] in 1844 where he was a founding member and served as first president of [[Phi Alpha Literary Society]].<ref>[http://www.archive.org/stream/cu31924028805808/cu31924028805808_djvu.txt Historic Morgan and classic Jacksonville]</ref><ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=Q05OAAAAMAAJ&q=%22phi+alpha%22+jayne+wilkinson+wright+baldwin+-immortal&dq=%22phi+alpha%22+jayne+wilkinson+wright+baldwin+-immortal&hl=en&ei=itxATdz2LYH-8Ab3psyLBA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCQQ6AEwAA Illinois College: A Centennial History, 1829-1929 p.132]</ref><ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=w_oTAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA25&dq=Robert++Wilson&ei=88VATZvZFIzkNYaIsf4L&cd=4#v=onepage&q=Robert%20%20Wilson&f=false Manual of College Literary Societies with Statistical Table]</ref><ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=qvUSAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA17#v=onepage&q&f=false Catalogue of Phi Alpha Society]</ref> He formed part of the three man committee that prepared the society's constitution.<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?ei=yuVQTarOLMKdgQf_wp3aCA&ct=result&id=Q05OAAAAMAAJ&dq=Illinois+College%3A+a+centennial+history%2C+1829-1929&q=lovers+of+truth#search_anchor Illinois College: A Centennial History, 1829-1929 p.133]</ref> He graduated in medicine from the [[University of Missouri]] in 1849. He began his practice in Springfield and served as [[Abraham Lincoln|Abraham Lincoln's]] personal physician. He became mayor of Springfield in 1859, and then a member of the State Senate in 1860, but resigned in 1861 to accept the appointment by President Lincoln to be the first [[Governors of Dakota Territory|Governor of Dakota Territory]]. He served from May 27, 1861, until 1863, then as a Delegate to the House of Representatives from March 4, 1863, to June 17, 1864. Jayne then returned to Springfield and continued the practice of medicine. He was appointed U.S. Pension Agent in 1869 for four years and served three terms as mayor of Springfield beginning in 1876. He also served as Director and Vice President of the First National Bank of Springfield. He resumed the practice of medicine in 1873. He married Julia Witherbee in 1850 and had six children with her. He died in Springfield and is interred in [[Oak Ridge Cemetery]] in Springfield. ==References== {{reflist}} {{CongBio|J000066}} ==External links== *{{CongBio|J000066}} *{{Find a Grave|21269}} {{start box}} {{s-off|us}} {{succession box |before=''Governors of [[Governors of Minnesota Territory|Minnesota]] and [[Governors of Nebraska Territory|Nebraska]] Territories'' |title=[[Governor of Dakota Territory]] |years=1861–1863 |after=[[Newton Edmunds]]}} {{s-par|us-hs}} {{USRepSuccessionBox |state=Dakota Territory |type=Delegate |before=[[John Blair Smith Todd|John B.S. Todd]] |after=[[John Blair Smith Todd|John B.S. Todd]] |years=March 4, 1863 – June 17, 1864}} {{end box}} {{Governors of Dakota Territory}} {{Authority control|VIAF=65577305}} {{Persondata |NAME=Jayne, William |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION=Physician and statesman |DATE OF BIRTH=October 8, 1826 |PLACE OF BIRTH=[[Springfield, Illinois]] |DATE OF DEATH=March 20, 1916 |PLACE OF DEATH=[[Springfield, Illinois]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jayne, William}} [[Category:1826 births]] [[Category:1916 deaths]] [[Category:Governors of Dakota Territory]] [[Category:Illinois State Senators]] [[Category:Illinois Republicans]] [[Category:Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from Dakota Territory]] [[Category:Mayors of Springfield, Illinois]] [[Category:American physicians]] [[Category:University of Missouri alumni]] [[Category:People of North Dakota in the American Civil War]] [[Category:People of Illinois in the American Civil War]] [[Category:Illinois College alumni]]
